fields.summary: SourceTree Crush Report (Version 1.6.4.0)

fields.description:
SourceTree doesn't automatically refresh the repository state when files are changed and I have to hit F5 to perform a manual refresh each time.

It was working a few versions ago, until I selected the "Always display full console output" option. I have since deselected that option. I noticed that the changelog for 1.6.1 included a bugfix for this issue, but it didn't fix it for me.

I have the "Refresh automatically when files changed" option selected and I have tried a uninstalling and reinstalling version 1.6.4.
fields.summary: SourceTree not refreshing

fields.description:
SourceTree crashed when I was hiding/showing nodes in the "Remotes" tree.

This bug does not always happen. It has only happened twice. What I was doing was to show and hide some of the branches of the tree I enclosed in red in the picture I attached. That was it.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when touching

fields.description: The overall appearance of the SourceTree application does not conform to the Windows High Contrast scheme.  For example, every other line in the unstaged files list is unreadable.
fields.summary: User interface text not visible with Windows High Contrast scheme
When add big commit, files rendering in modal window and buttons are not visibly. See screenshot.

fields.description:
I was switching back and forth between the blame window and the main window, and noticed a couple of times after switching to my browser and back to SourceTree, the part of the window showing commit details (files list, commit message, small diff window) would get empty.

After going back to the blame and selecting 'View In Full Log' again on the same revision, SourceTree crashed. Here's the relevant part of the log file:

fields.summary: Crash after clicking 'View In Full Log' in the blame window
Add ability to call blame while ignoring whitespace

fields.description:
There are too many whitespace or new line in "Show Full Output" during Git operation.

Those whitespace or new line should be removed or reduced.
fields.summary: Too many whitespace/new line in "Show Full Output"

fields.description: After upgrading to 1.6.4 every action I take that requires a screen update seems to hang the UI.  The Log / History pane clears and is replaced with Loading....   Only way to clear that I've found is to end and restart Sourcetree.
fields.summary: UI hangs after branch change and push actions

fields.description:
I have different tools for file compare / merge: Beyond compare works great on text files but has hard time merging xml files were there xml nodes are not in the same order.
For xml merging I have another tool that handles xml merging amazingly but it does not support merging of text files.

My suggestion is to add support for external diff/merge based on the file extension. I should have a default like today but still be able to specify for specific extensions a different tool to be used
fields.summary: Add support for file diff based on extensions
Source Tree crashed

fields.description:
Before the major change to the UI (and what most likely is a new component to render lists), you could select all files that were changed in a commit in the "Log / History" tab, hit Ctrl+C, and then paste the paths wherever you wanted (Notepad, Excel, etc.)

The real use for this is to copy the files modified between two releases, i.e. the diff between two commits.

Now Ctrl+C just copies blank lines.
fields.summary: Regression - Copy changed files paths from "Log / History" is now broken

fields.description: Make it easier to ignore or remove specific lines in a file. I know this is inherently difficult due to the nature of git, however it would prove massively useful. Basically integrate what  BFG Repo-Cleaner does.
fields.summary: Ignore/Remove specific lines in Git

fields.description: I tried to delete a stash, and the SourceTree crash dialog opened.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed while deleting a stash.

fields.description:
In the staging area, if the long path is shorten by ellipsis (...), forward slash will be used for the path. If the path is not shorten by ellipsis, backslash (Windows) will be used for the path.

The path in SourceTree for Windows should be backslash not forward slash.
fields.summary: Forward slash used for long path shorten by ellipsis

fields.description:
When SourceTree in maximize mode after started, it is not possible to resize diff panel. If SourceTree is "de-masimized", then diff panel can be resized.

After SourceTree is restarted in maximize mode, diff panel can't be resized again.
fields.summary: Couldn't resize diff panel when SourceTree in Maximize mode

fields.description:
I want to copy paths of modified files from commit history area and SourceTree crashed.
Steps:
1. Select any commit by click
2. When commit information is loaded to all areas I click on modified file path and try to push Ctrl+C
3. Crash(

fields.summary: Application crashes if I click Ctrl+C at history area

fields.description: see attachment
fields.summary: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

fields.description:
When committing a file SourceTree automatically switches to the "Log / History" tab. There is a setting to "disable" this behavior: Options > General > "After committing, stay in commit dialog if there are still pending changes". But sadly this setting has no effect. Steps to reproduce:

1. Enable setting (see above)
2. Open repository with changed files
3. Commit one of the files
4. See that the tab is switched to "Log / History"

Expected behavior:
4. Current tab is still "File Status"

Generally speaking I don't want the tab to switch at all but that is another issue.
fields.summary: Setting to stay in commit dialog has no effect

fields.description:
It would be great if user could close repository tabs by clicking middle mouse button.
(For example, like it is done in chrome or eclipse)
fields.summary: Close repository tabs by middle mouse button clicking

fields.description:
This feature provides user additional space to view complete path and the file contents when minimized.
- Would be nice if the sourcetree has an option to save user preferences on window sizing.
fields.summary: Functionality to minimize left most pane (repository exploer)

fields.description:
Recently we started using JIRA as our bug-tracker. I know there is the possibility to use 'Commit Text Links' to give some sort of JIRA integration, but it would be awesome if you could see all your JIRA issues within SourceTree and close/ fix issues automaticly with your commit.

Netbeans IDE has a feature like this and it is an awesome feature which can speed-up developmentflows tremendously.
fields.summary: JIRA integration

fields.description:
If a user clicks on a hunk to give the application focus, the stage hunk and discard hunk buttons are replaced with stage line and discard line. If the user decides to stage/discard the whole hunk the user will need to do multiple steps to achieve this vice clicking the stage/discard hunk button which is what would be expected. 
Workarounds:
1) Click stage/discard line and if on a line that changed, the hunk buttons come back.
2) Click CTRL+A and stage/discard lines.
3) Select another file (if available and go back) and the hunk buttons will return.

Perhaps an acceptable compromise for the absence of the buttons would be to allow the user to unselect lines by clicking on them again, which would allow the stage/discard hunks to be displayed when no lines are selected.

I know the UI was "cleaned up" but it does make thinks a little harder to use. One UI change I figured out but seems odd was checking the box next to Unstaged Files actually stages the files not yet staged. It appears the label is trying to do dual use, but UI looks like that check box should select all files in that list, however, again the expected buttons are missing to move them to the staged area. This I can get use to like clicking start to shutdown. Personally had I known of the UI redesign, I would have held off updating.
fields.summary: Allow user to easily stage a hunk after clicking in a hunk.

fields.description: I encountered the same bug as described in issue SRCTREEWIN-1751. In my case with russian text. I recorded screencast which demonstrates buggy behaviour: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qHB8d9eKq2U
fields.summary: Russian text in commit messages is not visible after interactive rebase

fields.description:
Using sourcetreeapp on a large github repository can be difficult when the number of files grows.

The working copy changes can get sluggish when you have 500+ files.

I typically work around this issue by sorting by path to help hunt for the files I need.

It would be even greater, if I could filter directories to reduce the set of files that I'm moving to the staging area. I.e. 

I have a folder structure like:

gameEngine\projectExample\lots of files
MonoGame\ExitExample
MonoGame\VirtualController
Unity\ExitExample
Unity\ClickExample

When I'm checking in a new game engine example I'd like to filter based on a folder like:

Unity\VirtualControllerExample where the Working Copy Changes view would only show files and subfolders and other sub levels of Unity\VirtualControllerExample\... when I've right clicked and filtered a file or folder.

And then I could unset the filter and it would go back to normal operation.

That kind of enhancement would speed up my work flow instead of always needing to sort by path.

Thanks!
fields.summary: SourceTreeApp - Working Copy Folder Filter

fields.description:
Problem is evident in screenshot.

ST won't let me change branches if there are uncommitted/unstashed file changes (good). If I commit the files I want to keep and click "Discard" to rid my branch of the other(s), and then select the file(s) to discard, about half of the time ST claims I haven't selected a file (bad).

If I click "Reset All", that works fine, but it's just a workaround for now.
fields.summary: SourceTree "Discard" function won't recognize file selection

fields.description:
Please synchronize the repository bookmark pane with repository tab (or add an option to keep them synchronized). When I select a repository tab, the bookmark for the repository should be highlighted. When I select (single-click) a repository bookmark, the repository tab, if open, should receive focus. If the repository tab is not open, then the current behavior of double-clicking the bookmark to open the repository tab is fine.

Not having the repository bookmark synchronized with the repository tab often leads to performing operations on the wrong repository.
fields.summary: Synchronize repository bookmark pane with repository tab

fields.description:
Before I upgraded to 1.6.3 - I used to be able and copy the list of staged files and then paste them into Excel and it would preserve the columns with:

[blank]     [filename]    [file path]

the blank row was for icons, and was fine that it was blank in Excel.

Now when I select a row and copy and paste it into Excel I get nothing.

This was helpful for me to track deployments with excel.
fields.summary: Copy and paste from unstaged files no longer working

fields.description:
If the machine system is configured in French and SourceTree using Automatic language settings (hence, French), initialising Git flow will cause SourceTree to crash:
{noformat}
2014-09-03T11:21:05: Fatal error: 
System.FormatException: L'index (de base zéro) doit être supérieur ou égal à zéro et inférieur à la taille de la liste des arguments.

Switching the UI to English through SourceTree configs solved the problem.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on git flow initialisation with French UI

fields.description:
On any mercurial repo, if I go on the "Log/History" tab, and click on "Uncommitted changes" at the top, it displays the changed files. If I click on one, it displays the diff correctly, but if I then right-click on it sourcetree crashes.

Also, this may or may not be relevant: when on the "Discard Changes" window, I get a popup saying "Please select at least one file to discard", even if I select files to discard. The "Reset All" feature works as expected.
fields.summary: Crash when right-clicking uncommitted changes

fields.description: Why couldn't we organize our tags nicely? :)
fields.summary: Groupings tag in folders

fields.description:
Dear,

I recently had a popup that a new update is availible in sourcetree for windows. I accepted the upgrade and the new version 1.6.3.0 was installed. I'm not so happy about this version due to slow reactions of the program, slow file preview loading: basicly alot has slowed down.

My question is: how do i downgrade to the previous version?
Is this possible?

OS: Windows 7 Enterprise

Kind regards,

Yves
fields.summary: Downgrade sourcetree to previous version

fields.description:
With your recent updates the behavior I liked has changed.

2. 
I often add and alter a large number of files. I used to be able to Stage All of them with a single click. Now I have to stage then one by one. And if I select them too quickly I get an error. (I need to wait about 1 to 2 second before selecting the next file)
Did these changes get made because of your updates or did something change in my configuration?
fields.summary: Wait time between staging files is 1-2 seconds (too long)

fields.description:
With your recent updates the behavior I liked has changed.
1.
On the left side(book marks??) I could at a glance see what changed in my working copies for all of my projects. Now I have to go to each project select File Status, Working copy. Then change the filter to Show All files and sort by file status.

Did these changes get made because of your updates or did something change in my configuration?
fields.summary: lost default view of all working copies

fields.description:
Before "major" upgrade, I used to stage all files by selecting all files with Mouse + Shift selection, looking through all changes at change area and finally right clicking -> add to staged on selected subset of files.
Right now it is impossible to do as selecting all files causing showing only one file to show for a second, and change area is absolutely empty for another sec, then it show another file for a sec, and empty again, and over and over. That is repeatable, and even when files are unselected back, they come back selected and become unselected, over and over again, and only switching to another repo/changing branch helps to avoid blinking and source tree can be used again.
fields.summary: Selecting all files in Staged/Unstaged sections causing permanent blinking at change area log
crashes that trying to apply patch

fields.description:
I have created on Custom Action.
The action is visible from Actions->Custom Actions, however I would expect the action also to be visible when I right click on a file because there the Custom Action menu is also visible.
fields.summary: Custom Action not working from right click

fields.description:
I got a crack and bug report dialog from SourceTree while it was doing something in the background.

Attached is the log.
fields.summary: Fatal error: 'Sorting' is not allowed during an AddNew or EditItem transaction

fields.description:
Although all panes are resizable, none of the positions are remembered in between sessions, which makes the resizing feature almost pointless. The defaults are probably ok for some people, but I usually prefer a much wider diff view and higher commit history view as that fits my workflow (see first attachment).
However after every restart the layout simply reverts to what it was before (see second attachment). This should be saved and restored - not just the ones in the screenshots, but all of them. (IIRC this was the case in 1.5.x?)
fields.summary: Layout is not remembered

fields.description: See screenshot, taken right after startup: the file has about 20 changed lines but no diff is shown. This does not occur every single time though, and can be resolved by first clicking another commit
fields.summary: Diff view remains empty after startup even though there are changes

fields.description:
Just crashed when I right-clicked.
This is reproductible.

After installing update 1.6.3 this now works.
fields.summary: Crashed while right-clicking on a merge conflict (warning sign)

fields.description:
Thank you for the great app. 

I cannot change the IME mode when I enter the commit message for git. 
I can change the IME mode by moving the focus.

---

The new version of SourceTree(1.8.2.11) has been released, but this problem was not repaired unfortunately.

Attach since the recording problem.

When I change the focus, it will be switched ON / OFF of the IME.
fields.summary: I cannot change the IME mode.

fields.description:
Hi this is just some user feedback on the staging behaviour in the new UI
Not a complaint or anything, Sourcetree is a great system and the price is right! keep up the great work

The previous behaviour of selecting a few checkboxes and then clicking the arrow to stage was much more user friendly.

Now when everytime you tick a checkbox it automatically moves the file from unstaged to stage. This seems to be doing the user a favour because of saving button clicks but it is actually a little disorienting because both the Staged Files and Unstaged files lists change with every click.

Often you identify visually a handful of files in the Unstaged list that you want to stage, but when the list changes on every click, you need to re-scan with your eyes after each click

Thanks for Sourcetree!
fields.summary: Staging behaviour checkbox select

fields.description:
I started a new hotfix using the Hg Flow button on the top menu and did some commits on the hotfix branch. After I'm finished, I pressed the the Hg Flow button again and clicked Finish Hotfix.
The preview dialog is shown, but the OK button gets disabled half a second after the dialog is opened. Even when you are quick enough to hit the button, nothing happens.
Maybe this happens because there's no remote configured for this repo, but it still doesn't make sense.

Basically this makes the Hg Flow extension completely unusable at the moment.

I'm having the impression the latest release wasn't tested very thoroughly with Hg with Atlassian moving towards Git.
I understand that Atlassian might prioritize their resources for the most widespread system, but this kind of half-baked support for Hg just doesn't fit with the usually quality I'm used from your company (and earlier versions of SourceTree).
fields.summary: Hg-Flow Finish Hotfix not working

fields.description:
Crash report included: sourcetree.log
My SourceTree version is 1.6.3.0
fields.summary: Fatal error:  System.InvalidOperationException: 'Sorting' is not allowed during an AddNew or EditItem transaction.

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to ask for an smal enhancement for the Diff view panel: being able to stage or discard severals hunks at a time by checking some boxes and push a button! (see attachment)

Might be a big time saver, as the Diff panel always reload (sometimes a lot of times!) when acting on hunks.

Thanks,
Matthieu
fields.summary: Diff view, Stage and discard several hunks at a time

fields.description:
It would be very useful to be able to see the phase of a changeset in the log view - both as a column in the graph as well as a row in the changeset details view (left pane right below graph view).

This would make it much easier to see which changes I've pushed and which I have not. Right now I have to either go to the command line or open the Push view, both of which take time and are out-of-band with my normal log browsing workflow.
fields.summary: Add column for hg phase

fields.description:
The bookmark icon in the log view is showing leading space. I'm assuming this comes from the output of "hg bookmarks" which uses spaces to left-align the names.

Easy to repro. Just do "hg bo test" then "hg bo test2". Two bookmarks will get created, the second marked as active with *. Both will show in the log view not left-aligned, as in the attached screen shot.

Fix would be to simply trim leading whitespace from the bookmark when showing in the log view.
fields.summary: Need to strip leading whitespace from hg bookmark names

fields.description:
I have a javascript file that I have changed, it show up as changed but it shows that the first row is changed but it's not, and the rest of the file is the old version not the newly changed file.if I use open in explorer I'll get the changed file.

If you need more information let me know how I can assist.
fields.summary: New file informationon not showing in Diff view

fields.description:
Sorry guys, but I just updated from 1.5.x to 1.6.3 without knowing what I was in for, and this should *not* have been released. Period. While the new ui looks somewhat slicker, the usability went down and features used daily, even hourly, are now gone or burried deeper. (I'm just posting all issues I found in one single issue now as I don't have time to search for them or to create different issues - will search for duplicates later)


- commit dialog is now and integrated into {{File Status}} tab. I could live with that, were it not that when you're in the {{Log/History}} tab and then commit, the view doesn't go back to the {{Log/History}} tab after committing. Meaning you are forced to click it again. I practically Live in the {{Log/History}} tab so this is a mess - see SRCTREEWIN-2048
- commit dialog used to have a checkbox {{Ammend Last Commit}} which is now under a seperate combobox. I'd guess one of the reasons it wasn't earlier is because you typically use it often to quickly change just the message of the last commit. I get that this was some sort of unification, but if the {{Push changes immediately}} checkbox can stay, why not the {{Ammend}} one? Or at least provide a preference setting for it?
- same remark for the options for viewing whitespace diff and number of context lines shown.. Making a UI slicker by stuffing away options behind menus pretty much means forcing more clicking upon the user, more clicking = reduced usability. At least allow customisation of the UI then instead of forcing everybody what some design team decided looks best, as is the case for most major Windows software packages.
- sometimes the diff view stays completely empty when only whitespace differences are found - see SRCTREEWIN-2150
- the width nor height of many, if not all, layout panes is not remembered across sessions, which is terrible - see SRCTREEWIN-2151
- in {{Log/History}} view, when switching between a commit and {{Uncommitted changes}} by clicking in the history, the layout changes
- checkbox for {{Staged files}} in {{Log/History}} tab is always on. Hence it shouldn't be a checkbox, or it should be make clear what it does. Vice-versa for the {{Unstaged files}} one.
- putting the {{Open in Explorer}} button when there's nothing to cimmit seems like a nice idea, but the button disappears completely when there is something to commit. That makes no sense. - see SRCTREEWIN-1971
- after clikcing on a changed line in the commit view, the button changes form {{Reverse hunk}} to {{Reverse lines}} but there doesn't seem a way to get back?
- after discarding all changed hunks, the {{Uncommited changes}} line stays present in the log view until another commit is clicked
fields.summary: Serious usability issues in 1.6 release

fields.description:
- Open SourceTree
- Display the "file status" view on a repository
- Click on a file listed in the "Unstaged files" part
- Crash, cf. report log
fields.summary: Crash when clicking on unstaged files

fields.description: when collapsing tag list, SourceTree always crashes
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when collapsing Tag-list

fields.description:
If I have uncommited changes in my working copy and I want to pull from a remote it would be nice if there is the possibility to auto-stash the changes away. After the pull the stashed changes could be applied back to the working copy. So it would be one workflow and I dont need to stash, pull and pop manually.

This option could be realized by a checkbox in the pull dialog. After the pull there could be raised a message box that asks if the auto-stashed changes should be applied again.
fields.summary: Possibility to auto-stash before a pull

fields.description:
When I select a file to view changes, the diff view flashes with content and then remains blank. It periodically shows a progress indicator (circular working indicator), flashes a diff and then returns to being blank.

Is there a temporary workaround while the problem is being investigated?
fields.summary: Source Diff Broken

fields.description: SourceTree by default stores configuration information in {{%LOCALAPPDATA%}} (defaults to C:\Users\{username}\AppData\Local).  This does not work for people who use roaming profiles like we do at the University of Wisconsin-Madison.  Every time a user starts SourceTree it asks them questions as if it were the first use.    Please either use {{%APPDATA%}} (defaults to C:\Users\{username}\AppData\Roaming) which _is_ compatible, or allow the location to be configurable.  Other groups are having [the same issue|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/306304/where-does-sourcetree-store-repository-configurations] but there doesn't seem to be a solution.
fields.summary: Incompatible with roaming profiles

fields.description:
Create an option that allows us to automatically check the "Rebase on development branch" when finishing a feature and therefore execute gitflow -r by default (instead of merge). 
I don't believe that's a behaviour we can configure in gitflow config file, correct me if i'm wrong.
fields.summary: default rebase option for gitflow finish feature

fields.description:
I simply tried to load 2 git repositories on a build VM.
This is via SSH key
size are 218.83MB and 1.01GB respectively
fields.summary: Crash when loading multiple git repository
danish character in branch name will have an error during create/close

fields.description:
If you select one or more pending files and use the space bar to toggle the checkboxes state, the change is not recognised and does not enable/disable the Commit button. 

It only works when you toggled the checkbox using a mouse click.
fields.summary: Commit button not enabled when checkboxes checked using the space bar

fields.description: While commiting changes in pending files window files with russian symbols in their names are displayed incorrectly.
fields.summary: Filename encoding in commit window

fields.description: Previously, these were visible on screen. Now they are hidden away in an menu that only allows one option to be chosen at a time. Annoying.
fields.summary: No visual representation of diff lines of content or white space

fields.description: Open Sourcetree with a file containing changes, drag-drop this file to the stage area, Sourcetree crashes.
fields.summary: Drag-dropping a file to the stage area crashes Sourcetree

fields.description:
Cloning works as expected, but after changing branches I got a message and an abnormal end after accepting the message. 
Please see the screenshots.

I guess that this is related to a submodule that is present on the branch. Also got the same error trying to open the submodule.
fields.summary: Abnormal end after changing branch

fields.description: Bit bucket is not showing some changed files in the unstaged section. At the same time all other files are showing perfectly with the changes made. There is no sequence or repeated scenarios for this issue. If i changed 10 or more pages sometimes its not showing one or two pages most of the time
fields.summary: Source Tree not Showing changed pages in Unstaged Files section

fields.description: It would be great if SourceTree could provide icons to support HDPI displays. See the attached screenshot taken on a 2013 Dell XPS 15 (3200x1800)
fields.summary: HDPI icon support
Bypass commit hooks not working

fields.description:
Recently after the SourceTree 1.6 upgrade, I have been problem where SourceTree does not notice I changed the source files.  The easiest workaround is to close to the tab and re-open it.

I am using simple, local-only repositories (no remotes).  I tested this on the local hard drive and a network folder.
fields.summary: changes

fields.description:
Using the Git Flow functionality in SourceTree; if I start a new release branch and then a hotfix branch; if the hotfix branch is completed prior to the release being completed, the hotfix gets merged back into develop but not into the release branch. The result of this is that it's possible to regress hotfixes accidentally in released versions if you forget to manually merge your hotfix branches into the ongoing release branch before completing it.

According to @nvie (see [Finishing a hotfix branch|http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/]) the flow should be that hotfixes are merged into develop unless there is a release ongoing, in which case it should be merged into the current release branch instead as this will get merged back into develop once the release is completed.
fields.summary: Gitflow integration merges hotfix branch into develop but not release

fields.description:
I have a long list of unstaged changes, like here:
!2014-08-29 14_03_36-SourceTree.png!

I now stage the first file by clicking the checkbox. I would expect that "GCMIntentService.java" would now be the first file in the unstaged changes area. But, instead, a completely random file takes that place:

!2014-08-29 14_04_23-SourceTree.png!

This is extremely confusing and caused me to mess up several commits :(
fields.summary: Unstaged files are reordered when staging a file

fields.description: So this is the first time it happens where sourcetree doesn't show a lot of untracked/ modified changes I made. If I do a gitstatus from the terminal I clearly see them. See attached picture.
fields.summary: GUI not showing modifications/untracked files to be added

fields.description:
The diff view does not show the diff of the default selected file on startup.

We need to select other file first before selecting the same file again.
fields.summary: Diff view does not work on default selected file on startup

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a patch using the ContextMenu>Create Patch or Actions>Create Patch for an uncommitted working copy.

As soon as I submit the patch dialog, a MessageBox pops up with the title "No files selected" and content "Please select at least one file", although I have checked every file in the list (even highlighting with Shift+Mouse selection doesn't help).

This means creating patches for working copies with Hg repos is currently not possible.
fields.summary: Create patch stopped working (Hg)

fields.description:
Only cancel button is enabled. Clicking it shows error window with following text:

[SEH_AV_READ_BADPTR] ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at address [0x00a9301d]

*** Stack Trace (x86) ***

[0x00a9301d]  -----
[0x035efd4c]  -----
[0x755a1e59]  GetProcAddress()
[0x00ac2942]  -----
[0x00ac29b8]  -----
[0x00a5e312]  -----
[0x77b69f72]  RtlInitializeExceptionChain()
[0x77b69f45]  RtlInitializeExceptionChain()
[0x00a00000]  MODULE_BASE_ADDRESS
fields.summary: Trying to update from 1.6.1 to 1.6.3 - installer stucks

fields.description: Since 1.6 are some translations lost. E.g. while staging on the right with the diffs that buttons were already translated in earlier versions.
fields.summary: Deleted translation for Stage/Discard hunk/lines buttons

fields.description:
I just updated from 1.6.0 to 1.6.3 no sure in which revision this bug was added.

I have to use the context menu or a key combination for staging files that is a little annoying. Please fix this! I want to drag and drop again.
fields.summary: Cannot drag&drop files for staging

fields.description: When staging files, if you receive an error message that index.lock can't be created because it already exists the modal window can't be closed. Clicking close does nothing and the modal window stays open. To continue you have to close Sourcetree.
fields.summary: unable to create index.lock error results in Sourcetree locking and requiring a quit to continue

fields.description:
I'm having all sorts of reliability issues with 1.6.3 (which is the least unstable 1.6.x until now).

Things like this make working with it really unpleasant as they are intermittent and I've spend more than an hour trying to find reproducible cases.

- during operations the focus gets lots, especially when checking in and copying change-set descriptions: the edit Windows don't get focus.
- during checkin, files appear from the staging area, and when you start 1.5.2 they are just there. This happens most frequently when you have changed files after you put some of them into the staging area.

1.5.2 was reliable, even in the lack of support for certain things or things that didn't work well: it would either work all the time, or fail all the time.

1.6.x looks more polished than 1.6.x, but is harder to work with (as some operations are now hidden behind menus).

But the thing that got me reverting to 1.5.2 is that 1.6.x is unreliable. Things work most of the time, then just fail.

I'm not sure yet, but the impression so far is that 1.6.x also uses more memory than 1.5.x, I think a lot more. I won't try for a while: I will watch the summary panel becoming less red before updating again. 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:summary-panel
fields.summary: Reverted back to 1.5.2 as 1.6.3 is too unreliable

fields.description:
Would it be possible to extend current stash behavior? Now it only allows to stash all and delete/keep changes in working directory which is useful but sometimes I would like to stash only some changes in my stash. Not all of them!

So far I'm using:
>> git stash save --patch
which brings console interactive mode but we're living in age when we can do such things graphically ;-)

In case of question please ask ;-)
fields.summary: git-stash interactive mode in SourceTree

fields.description:
After commenting on this on ticket SRCTREEWIN-2038, I checked what is going on and it doesn't feel right.

I have disabled "refresh automatically when files change" and I see git being started 3-4 times within a second. These are the commands being executed all the time, for the different repositories:

 status --porcelain --untracked-files=all --ignore-submodules=dirty
 show-ref --head --dereference
 remote -v
 branch -r
 stash list
 rev-parse HEAD^1
 branch
 branch -vv
 rev-parse HEAD

Some commands are execute for the same repository several times in a row, within the same second. Is this really necessary? Shouldn't this be checked only when refreshing?

I gahered the information using ProcessMonitor from Sysinternals, setting a filter for showing only "start process" events and with parent id = sourcetree's.
fields.summary: Why are so many git processes being launched in the background?

fields.description:
Since version 1.6 SourceTree don't show progress when user in "File Status" tab press Refresh (F5).
In projects with many files (in my case about 4000 file) Refresh can take some time. User, after pressing Refresh, don't see that something happens.
In earlier versions there was some rotating sign.
Is it possible make some kind of progress for long processes?
fields.summary: Show progress during file status Refresh

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.6.3 does not use NTLM when downloading Git but it use it when checking for updates.

It should use NTLM when downloading Git too.
fields.summary: Support NTLM when downloading Git

fields.description:
The left side panel takes up a lot of precious space for a feature that's being used 1% of the time.

Maybe I talk only for myself, but when working on a project I usually spend weeks if not month on one project and therefore I have little use of the left panel.
Trouble is, this panel is huge and sacrifice a lot of space to display frequently used/seen features like file compare, staging, etc...

I use a 15' mac book pro, so I don't have a huge real estate display.

Would it be possible to show/hide/minimize this panel on request ? ( Without having to drag the split bar )
fields.summary: Possibility to hide/show the left panel showing all repo

fields.description:
For example on the "File Status" page, when I changed the combo selection from `all files, sorted by file status` to `Modified files, sorted by file status`, it works for the running session only. When restarting the app, it resets the combo selection to `all files, sorted by file status`..

That's just an example but this also applies to split window positions among others.

So question is, would it be possible to serialize the UI positions/size/selections so that we can pick up work exactly where we left it off last time we ran SourceTree ?
fields.summary: UI should remember last user setup.

fields.description:
I understand why you have decided to remove the commit popup and merge all commit UI to the File Status window, but it is less intuitive in my opinion.

I always have the Log/ History tab open and my workflow was to:
- press the commit button (or by using CTRL-SHIFT-C), 
- type a commit message
- and pressing the commit button (or by using CTRL-ENTER)

Since all files where autoselected in this process it was a simple three-step option to commit everything and it would bring me back to the Log/ History view automaticly.

Since version 1.6 I have to perform these steps:
- press the commit button (or by using CTRL-SHIFT-C), 
- manually select the changed files (CTRL-A shortcut does not work here)
- manually select the commit textarea
- type a commit message
- and pressing the commit button (or by using CTRL-ENTER)
- press the Log/ History view tab to go back to the history view

As you can see it doubled the actions I have to perform to commit my files.

It would be fantastic if there would be an option in the settings which allows the old behavior of having the popup window just like the push window still is.

Hope this is possible.

Regards,
Bas
fields.summary: Optional commit popup

fields.description:
Currently, selects a file will auto show its diff, but this operation will block the UI if the diff is very large, especially multiple selection.
I suggest that could let the diff calculation do in background, so the UI will not be blocked anymore.
fields.summary: Don't block the ui when calculating diff

fields.description:
If Windows is set to use "High Contrast Accessibility theme", SourceTree does not follow the system color and its still using its own color.

SourceTree should have changed its color to match the system color or theme.
fields.summary: SourceTree should have follow system color

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create repository on Stash (e.g. "best repository ever")
# Initialize repository and push from SourceTree to Stash
# Change the name of the repository in Stash (e.g. "worst repository ever")
# Create a new repository in Stash with the old name ("best repository ever")
# Clone the new repo (with the old name) into SourceTree
# There should be an existing clone on your local machine. Instead of selecting that, go to the "New Clone" tab.
# Click "Clone" (don't change anything in the window prompt)

And then it crashes...

I've attached the log as well.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when Saving a New Clone

fields.description:
If there is a changes in the SourceTree UI and function, users are not updated on the changes except following the blogs.

It would be better to have a Welcome screen during upgrade to update the users about the changes.
fields.summary: Welcome screen during upgrade to introduce new feature or UI change

fields.description:
Currently when I have committed all changes, SourceTree leaves me on this blank screen where the only option is to go to Explorer.

It would me much more useful to go back to the branch history screen that i had been working from.
fields.summary: When I commit all changes, return me to the branch history that I had been working from

fields.description:
When you check quickly multiple files to stage them, most of times appears a dialog titled "Staging files" with this info:

{quote}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false add -f -- my_path/my_file
fatal: Unable to create 'my_path/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.

Completed with errors, see above.
{quote}

Pressing the close button does nothing and the dialog remains in front. I can't keep working and I must restart source tree.
fields.summary: Checking multiple files to stage blocks Source Tree

fields.description:
SourceTree for Windows seems to not pick up the commit.template git config option. When I click the 'Commit' tool bar button, I get taken to the 'File Status' tab with the commit message area expanded. However, the commit template file contents are not pre-filled in the commit message text box.

Committing from the command line does use the commit template, so the problem seems to be in SourceTree and not in my configuration.
fields.summary: Git commit.template config option is ignored by SourceTree for Windows

fields.description:
In the "SSH Client Configuration" options, one can specify an "SSH Key" and an "SSH Client". The choice of clients is OpenSSH and PuTTY, each of which uses a different private key format. Thus whatever is specified as "SSH Key" needs to be maintained along with what is set as the "SSH Client". This already seems to be partly implemented, as browsing for a key when PuTTY is selected as a client filters for *.ppk files, whereas for OpenSSH no file filter is set.

However, if first specifying an OpenSSH key, then choosing PuTTY to specify a PPK file and then switching back to OpenSSH, the "SSH Key" field is empty again. It does not seems to matter if the options dialog is closed and reopened after specifying the OpenSSH but before specifying the PuTTY key (I thought this maybe would trigger saving of the OpenSSH key).
fields.summary: SSH key is not properly maintained per client

fields.description:
If you have multiple unstaged files and select only some of them. When you try to drag them to staged pane the selection disappears.
You cannot drag even one file.
fields.summary: Multiselect & drag when staging does not work

fields.description:
In the SSH Client Configuration section of the Options dialog it says using OpenSSH is supported with "Git only, Mercurial always uses Plink on Windows". However, that seems to be a rather arbitrary limitation by SourceTree itself, as I can run my system's Mercurial 3.0.2 (64-bit) with OpenSSH just fine. Also [1] confirms that "ssh" (i.e. OpenSSH) is the default command for the ui.ssh setting.

I currently don't have PuTTY installed, and I don't want to, esp. as my .ssh/config file has already configured all the hosts I need. Using PuTTY would require me to create sessions for each host entry that I'd like to use with Mercurial (in order fo rthe correct key to by used with each host, as I don't like to run pageant either), which is double work that I'd like to avoid.

Thus it'd be great if OpenSSH was supported with Mercurial, too.

[1] http://www.selenic.com/mercurial/hgrc.5.html
fields.summary: Support OpenSSH with Mercurial

fields.description:
I installed latest version of source tree for windows ( 1.6.3.0 ) and it has made my work flow a world of pain.
Any action takes up to 5 seconds to complete, even the most basic ones like staging/unstaging, previewing a file...

If source tree was already slow in the previous versions, this has now become unproductive.

Regards
fields.summary: Source Tree is EXTREMELY slow for any action
rebase interactively Edit Message, chinese words will became ????

fields.description:
As soon as I upgraded to 1.6.3, I cannot commit anything.  Instead, when an "Uncommitted changes" line is selected in the timeline, the Log / History page shows a message "Nothing to commit" and a button "Open in Explorer".  (See attachment)  I think I was on 1.6.2 before.  It was working fine then.

I'm now having to do all my commits in TortoiseGit, which still does it fine.
fields.summary: "Nothing to commit" shown when there is something to commit

fields.description: I used to be able to select the Log/History file list, copy it, and paste it into a document.  This was useful for summarizing and tracking changes between versions.  Currently, pasting will just result in empty line feeds.
fields.summary: Can no longer copy/paste from lists
